result.execSummary:
The defendant Stanley Lindsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Bond applied to court costs, balance due during probation period. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Stanley Lindsey in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Buckett advises court a resolution has been made. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Court reviewed 8/24/2016 submission regarding defendant. Court will not withdraw warrant.
From Aurora Health Care regarding the defendant. Forwarded to Branch 1 clerk's document review.

Defendant contacted clerk stating he is in hospital and could not appear 8/23/2016. He was informed court date is 8/22/2016 and he must provide verification he is hospitalized. Informed warrant issued.
Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Stanley Lindsey who did not appear.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders bench warrant issued.
Clerk notified defendant that he does not have to appear today for hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing has been scheduled for 8/22/16. Notice of Hearing will be sent out.

Defendant Stanley Lindsey in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant called clerk, cannot appear for approximately 1 hr. If not resolved on 8/22/2016, case will be set for trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant called numerous times.  He is currently in the hospital awaiting surgery, he has been trying to contact Atty. Buckett.

Defendant contacted clerk that he will contact the public defender again, believes he may be eligible. He cannot make payments for court appointed atty. Clerk informed him he must contact the public defender promptly and submit proof of hospitalization for next court date.

Atty. Ben Van Severen will accept court appointment for defendant. Copy of complaint, notice and defendant's phone # provided to counsel. Atty. Van Severen was not available on 6/15/2016 court date so it was changed to 6/23/2016 at 10:00 am.
